learning_objective: Use an iterative process to plan the development of a program by including others' perspectives and considering user preferences.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex's family runs an agribusiness and they are developing a program to automate their inventory management. They have written a first version of the program but it's not very user-friendly. It doesn't consider the user interface and experience, due to which his parents and siblings are having trouble using it. What should be Alex's next steps to rectify the problem?",
    "Answer1": "Alex should discard this program and write a new one from scratch.",
    "Answer2": "Alex should force his family to learn the program as it is.",
    "Answer3": "Alex should consider his family's feedback, brainstorm ideas and iteratively make improvements on the user interface and user experience of the program.",
    "Answer4": "Alex doesn't need to do anything as it's not his problem if his family can't use the program.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "Considering other people's perspectives and user preferences is essential to make a program successful. Receiving feedback and iteratively improving the program will move it closer to the desired outcome.",
    "code_snippet": "integer numberOfApples = 0\ninteger numberOfOranges = 0\n\nask \"Enter the number of apples:\"\ninput numberOfApples\nask \"Enter the number of oranges:\"\ninput numberOfOranges\n\noutput \"Total number of fruits in inventory: \" + (numberOfApples + numberOfOranges)"
}
